heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 07 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (189°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 6.1°C) and outside temperature (down 5.0°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 470 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1332 m), feels like temperature (up 5.8°C), and outside temperature (up 4.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 469.9m lower than yesterday, 557.1m lower than the past week, 1332.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1181m minimum and 2400m maximum, with an average of 1128.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1685.8m and 2460m.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
